fields.name: St. Mary's Nyakhobi Senior School
fields.mission: To provide quality, affordable, and accessible education that prepares students for success in their academic pursuits and future careers while instilling strong moral values.
fields.vision: To be a leading educational institution in Kenya, recognized for academic excellence, innovation, and character development.
fields.description: St. Mary's Nyakhobi Senior School is a prestigious mixed secondary school located in Funyula, Busia County, Kenya. Established in 2010, we have consistently delivered quality education and produced graduates who excel in various fields.
fields.address: P.O. Box 123, Funyula, Busia County, Kenya

fields.name: Form 1 Program
fields.description: Foundation building year focusing on core subjects and study skills development. Students are introduced to secondary education with comprehensive curriculum coverage.

fields.name: Form 2 Program
fields.description: Skills development year with expanded curriculum including computer studies and business subjects. Students begin exploring their academic interests.

fields.name: Form 3 Program
fields.description: Specialization year where students choose between Sciences and Arts streams based on their career aspirations and academic strengths.
fields.requirements: Successful completion of Form 2 with good performance

fields.name: Form 4 Program
fields.description: KCSE preparation year with intensive revision, mock examinations, and university application guidance. Final year of secondary education.

fields.name: Mathematics Department
fields.description: Pure and applied mathematics, statistics, and problem-solving skills development

fields.name: Sciences Department
fields.description: Physics, Chemistry, Biology with emphasis on practical laboratory work and scientific research

fields.name: Languages Department
fields.description: English, Kiswahili, Literature with focus on communication skills and creative expression

fields.name: Humanities Department
fields.description: History, Geography, Christian Religious Education, and social studies

fields.bio: With over 15 years of experience in education, Mr. Wanyama leads our school with vision and dedication to academic excellence.
Mrs. Adhiambo oversees our academic programs and ensures high standards of teaching and learning across all subjects.
Mr. Ochieng manages the administrative affairs and ensures smooth operations of all school activities and programs.
12 years teaching experience. Specializes in KCSE preparation and mathematical problem solving.
10 years experience in science education with focus on practical laboratory work.
8 years teaching physics with emphasis on practical applications and experiments.
15 years in language education, drama club coordinator and debate coach.
9 years teaching Kiswahili language and literature with cultural emphasis.
11 years teaching humanities with focus on African history and geography.
7 years teaching geography with emphasis on environmental conservation.

fields.title: Inter-School Athletics Championship
fields.description: Annual athletics competition with schools from Busia County. Track and field events for all age groups including 100m, 200m, 800m, 1500m, relay races, long jump, high jump, and shot put.

fields.title: Science Fair 2025
fields.description: Students showcase innovative science projects and experiments. Open to parents and the community. Categories include Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and Environmental Science.

fields.title: Annual Drama Festival
fields.description: Students perform dramatic works, poetry, and cultural dances. A celebration of arts and creativity featuring original plays, poetry recitals, traditional dances, and musical performances.

fields.title: KCSE Mock Examinations
fields.description: Form 4 students take comprehensive mock examinations in preparation for the national KCSE exams. Covers all subjects with proper examination conditions.

fields.title: Parents Day & Academic Exhibition
fields.description: Parents meet teachers, view student work, and participate in school activities. Academic progress discussions, student exhibitions, and feedback sessions.

fields.title: Awards Day & Prize Giving
fields.description: Recognition of outstanding academic performance, sports achievements, and exemplary conduct. Presentation of trophies, certificates, and scholarships to deserving students.

fields.title: Outstanding KCSE Results 2024
fields.content: St. Mary's Nyakhobi Senior School celebrates exceptional performance in the 2024 KCSE examinations with a mean score of 8.9 points, representing a 12% improvement from the previous year. 45 students qualified for direct university admission with 15 students achieving A- grades. Top performer Sarah Wanjiku scored A- with 81 points. The school's best performing subjects were Mathematics, Chemistry, and Biology.

fields.title: Regional Science Competition Victory
fields.content: Our Form 3 Physics team won first place in the Busia County Science and Mathematics Competition with their project on Renewable Energy Solutions. The team competed against 25 schools and won a prize of KES 50,000. They will now represent the county at the national level competition. This achievement demonstrates our commitment to excellence in science education.

fields.title: Athletics Championship Success
fields.content: St. Mary's athletics team dominated the Western Kenya Secondary Schools Championships with 5 gold medals, 3 silver medals, and overall 2nd place. Star athlete John Odhiambo won gold in both 1500m and 5000m events. The girls relay team won gold in 4x100m, breaking 2 school records in the process. Eight students qualified for the national championships.

fields.title: New Laboratory Equipment Acquisition
fields.content: The school has acquired state-of-the-art laboratory equipment worth KES 2.5 million to enhance science education. The investment includes new microscopes and analyzers for the Chemistry lab, digital measuring instruments for Physics, and advanced specimen collection for Biology. This upgrade will significantly enhance practical learning experiences for our students.
